title: Apply per-industry color themes and add a safe fallback for missing logo

requirements.text: Implement the provided per-industry color schemes on all industry-specific pages so that each page uses its industry background color for the top hero/banner section and uses the industry primary color for key highlights (e.g., page title accent, section headings, links, icon accents) while maintaining a clean, modern corporate B2B look.

quotes:
Use the following color scheme for industry-specific pages.
Maintain a clean modern B2B corporate design.
Primary color = buttons, highlights, icons.
Accent color = optional secondary highlight.
Background color = page or hero background.

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting each industry route in the router (/industries/corporate-enterprise, /industries/education, /industries/healthcare, /industries/manufacturing, /industries/government, /industries/hospitality, /industries/banking, /industries/training-centers, /industries/retail, /industries/live-events) shows a visually distinct theme that matches the provided hex values for that industry.
The banner/hero wrapper at the top of ContentPage uses the industry background color (not the generic bg-muted/30) for industry pages.
Industry primary color is visible in at least: page title accent styling and link/interactive highlight styling within the page content area.

For industries that specify an accent_color (Manufacturing and Banking), the accent color is used as an optional secondary highlight (e.g., subtle badge/underline/divider) without replacing the primary color usage.
Non-industry pages (solutions, about, contact, etc.) retain the existing global theme and are not recolored by industry theme logic.

requirements.text: Add a centralized, explicit mapping from industry page IDs to their theme tokens (primary_color, optional accent_color, background_color) and ensure the mapping keys align with existing industry page IDs used by routing and content (e.g., corporate-enterprise, education, healthcare, manufacturing, government, hospitality, banking, training-centers, retail, live-events).

acceptanceCriteria: There is a single source of truth for industry theme values (hex codes) used by the UI.
Theme selection is based on the pageId already passed into ContentPage (no hardcoded per-route styling scattered across multiple components).
If a pageId is not in the mapping, the page renders with the existing default styling (no runtime errors).

requirements.text: Handle the missing/unuploaded logo gracefully across the header and footer by adding a robust fallback when the configured logo image cannot be loaded (e.g., swap to a text-based brand mark using BRAND.name or a locally-generated placeholder logo asset) without breaking layout in desktop or mobile navigation.

quotes: also take into account that logo isnt uploaded

acceptanceCriteria: If the logo image at BRAND.logo.path fails to load, the header and footer do not show a broken image icon and instead display a readable brand fallback (text-based or placeholder image) that preserves spacing/alignment.
The fallback works in both desktop header and mobile menu header area, and in the footer logo area.
All user-facing fallback text is in English and uses the existing brand constants (e.g., BRAND.name).

requirements.text: Add (or regenerate) a clean corporate wordmark placeholder logo image matching the existing configured logo path so the site has a consistent logo until the real logo is uploaded.

quotes: also take into account that logo isnt uploaded

acceptanceCriteria: A placeholder logo asset exists at the configured path used by the app (as defined in frontend/src/site/brand.ts).
The placeholder logo is legible at the current header/footer render size (className h-8 w-auto) and looks consistent with a clean corporate B2B design.
No backend changes are required to serve the logo; it is a static asset under frontend/public.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Use English for any user-facing text.
Keep the overall look clean, modern, and corporate B2B; do not introduce playful or consumer-styled visuals.
nonGoals: Do not change solution, about, contact, or homepage color themes beyond what is necessary to avoid being affected by industry-only theming.
Do not add new industries, routes, or content copy beyond applying the specified theming and logo fallback behavior.
Do not implement authentication or backend persistence changes (not requested).

required: Clean corporate wordmark logo on transparent background (logo-wordmark-updated.dim_600x160.png)
